# Welcome
Welcome to the second StepuP meeting. In this meeting we will host some workshops and hands on sessions to analyse EEG, EMG and motion capture data.

![](treadmill_walking.jpg){width="50%" fig-align="center"}

## Timetable
The meeting will be held on the 29th and 30th of November in Zurich.
The first day will consist of pratical data analysis and short presentations. The second day will be a full day of fun.

### Day 1 (Friday, 29th of November)

The first day will be held hybrid ( [Zoom link](https://ethz.zoom.us/j/62034078463) ) with some people in Zürich and some people joining online. We will start at 8:00 am localtime and end after the last lecture has finished.
The day will consist of presentations and hands-on analysis. We will cover:

### Materials
Please download the materials (data & code) for the hands-on session in the afternoon here:

-   BIDS example ([Code](https://github.com/StepuP-consortium/stepup_bids_converter) and [Data](https://cloud.rz.uni-kiel.de/index.php/s/rjTPpC2dKwFjiW8))
All slides and materials will be made avaliable online after the meeting.
In the afternoon we will perform analysis on example datasets and brainstorm.

-   Foot placement and EEG ([Data](https://surfdrive.surf.nl/files/index.php/s/sxZU6wVAQsjYitX))

-   Home assessment ([Data](https://polybox.ethz.ch/index.php/s/ntKGAiODKDX4LzV))

Please have Matlab pre-installed on your laptop with the following Toolboxes: FieldTrip Toolbox, Signal Processing Toolbox, Statistics and Machine Learning Toolbox, MATLAB Report Generator (optional, but not essential).

## Location
The meeting will be held in [ETH GLC](https://maps.app.goo.gl/HCY5QiNgmukd2wK48) in Zürich. The adress is Gloriastrasse 37/39, 8006 Zürich. The closest tramstop directly outside of the buildiung is "Voltastrasse" (Tram 5 and 6). We meet in Room no. E38.2.

## Transportation
If you are familiar with using a bike, an easy way to get around in Zürich is by bike. With [PubliBike](https://www.publibike.ch/en/map) you can rent bikes/e-bikes in many places around the city.
Alternatively the use of the public transport (trams, buses) is recommended. There are different options for single tickets and multi-cards available.

## Additional Information
Please note that Switzerland uses type "J" power sockets, which are not compatible with standard European laptop charging cables. Therefore, if you have a universal adapter, be sure to bring it with you.
